title: MANUFACTURE OF IRON OR STEEL  (preliminary treatment of ferrous ores or scrap C22B1/00; electric heating H05B)
informative_references: Furnaces, kilns, ovens or retorts in generalDetails or accessories of furnaces, kilns, ovens or retorts in general
special_rules: In the group , reforming is based on a reaction with other hydrocarbon containing gases. In the group , shift reactions involve steam, water vapor, or water. concerns the specific purification and reuse of exhaust gases in metallurgical processes, while  concerns only the purification process in general of waste gases from metallurgy plants.
definition_statement: This place covers: The production of iron or steel starting from iron ores, e.g. the production of pig-iron; The recovery of by-products, e.g. slag, from these production methods; Apparatus specially adapted therefore, e.g. blast furnaces, air heaters.

title: by applying additives, e.g. fluxing agents
special_rules: The group overlaps with , , , : depending on whether the additives are generally applicable or related to a specific process either in the Blast Furnace () or in Direct Reduction process (), double or single classification will apply.
definition_statement: This place covers: Processes in which the additives can be added to dry products (e.g. pellets, briquettes), a metal melt or a slag.

title: Recovery of by-products, e.g. slag
Treatment of liquid slag  (slag wool C03B; slag stones C04B)
informative_references: Processes or devices for granulating material

title: Cooling slag
informative_references: General arrangements of separating plantsIngredients other than water added to the slag ; treatment with gases or gas generating materialHandling or treating discharged material -
definition_statement: This place covers: Cooling covers both dry and wet methods of cooling.

title: Making pig-iron in the blast furnace
definition_statement: This place covers: Also the injection of additional (pure) oxygen and additional fuel; automatic control of the process; condition of the cokes or their characterisation; composition and distribution of the charge.

title: using top gas in the blast furnace process  (in coke ovens C10B)
informative_references: In coke ovensProduction of fuel gases by carburetting air or other gases without pyrolysis or of combustible gases containing carbon monoxide from solid carbonaceous fuelsPurifying or modifying the chemical composition of combustible gases containing carbon monoxide
special_rules: In case the top gas is treated before being sent back into the furnace, this aspect is also classified : either by the relevant class in another field (specific, e.g. , dust removal).

title: Blast furnaces  (lifts associated with blast furnaces B66B9/06)
informative_references: SeparationFiltering elements - Filtering materialCleaning of gases from solids - Separating solids from solids by wet methodsMagnetic or electrostatic separation of solid materials from solid materials or fluids, separation by high-voltage electric fieldsCentrifugesApparatus using free vortex flow, e.g. cyclonesPurfying or modifying the chemical composition of combustible gases containing carbon monoxide
special_rules: Groups  and  concern evacuating and treating of exhaust gases from blast furnaces in general. Further classification is mandatory in groups  - .
definition_statement: This place covers: Features which relate to the lay-out of the BF area or to repair ; also the evacuation and treatment of exhaust gases and the control and regulation of the top pressure.

title: with special refractories  (refractory materials C04B)
Linings for furnaces
informative_references: Arrangements of linings in shaft furnacesLinings or walls for metallurgical furnaces in general

title: Cooling; Devices therefor
informative_references: Cooling of linings of combustion chambersShaft furnaces with cooling arrangementsLinings or walls incorporating cooling arrangementsCooling of furnaces or of charges thereinHeat exchange apparatus in which heat exchange media do not come into direct contactDetails of heat exchange apparatus of general application
definition_statement: This place covers: Cooling devices for the walls and bottom including staves, plates, pipes, etc; also leakage detection.

title: Opening or sealing the tap holes
Discharging devices, e.g. for slag
informative_references: Charging or discharging liquid or molten material
definition_statement: This place covers: Runners and their accessories (roofs, heating etc); also equipment for transporting said runners.

with appliances for distributing the burden
informative_references: Transport or storage devices, including chutes, conveyor belts etcArrangements of devices for charging of shaft furnacesCharging of particulate materialCharging directly from hoppers or chutes
definition_statement: This place covers: All distribution means different from bell-and-hopper, i.e. including revolving chute.

title: Dust arresters
informative_references: SeparationFiltering elements - Filtering material - Cleaning of gases from solids - Separating solids from solids by wet methodsMagnetic or electrostatic separation of solid materials from solid materials or fluids, separation by high-voltage electric fieldsCentrifugesApparatus using free vortex flow, e.g. cyclonesPurifying or modifying the chemical composition of combustible gases containing carbon monoxideRemoval of waste gases or dust (from converter)Offtakes or separating apparatus for converter waste gases or dust

title: Test rods or other checking devices
informative_references: Arrangements of monitoring devices, of indicators, of alarm devices for shaft furnacesArrangements of controlling devicesArrangements of monitoring devices - Specific investigation or analysing means of materials by determining their chemical or physical properties
definition_statement: This place covers: Covers any measuring, controlling or observation devices

title: Making spongy iron or liquid steel, by direct processes
informative_references: General purpose Fluidised Beds - General methods of reducing to metals: - by solid carbonaceous reducing agents;- by gases, Fluidised bed furnaces -
special_rules: When disclosed, the apparatus or group of apparatuses () in which the process takes place, should always be given a classDetails of apparatuses being part of the invention should be classified in the relevant apparatus class (, ) when possible.
definition_statement: This place covers: Direct reduction processes obtaining either sponge iron or molten iron or steel. Inventions which concern the treatment of the reducing gases, the solid reductant, the ores, the reduced iron or the addition of fluxes or the treatment of the ores in a fluidised bed or lead to attainment of molten iron or steel.

title: in hearth-type furnaces
definition_statement: This place covers: Also rotary-hearth furnaces.

title: in electric furnaces
definition_statement: This place covers: Also using a plasma.

title: Multi-stage processes {processes carried out in different vessels or furnaces}
definition_statement: This place covers: Inventions in which different types of installations are used in sequence to arrive either at a solid or a molten product.

title: Other processes for the manufacture of iron from iron compounds  (general methods of reducing to metal C22B5/00; by electrolysis C25C1/06)
informative_references: General methods of reducing to metals -
definition_statement: This place covers: Also processes involving nuclear energy or a chloride process.
